Key Arguments: The bill represents significant government overreach and infringes on freedom of speech.
It places too much power in the hands of unelected bureaucrats, lacking transparency and accountability.
The government, TGA, and mainstream media should not be the exclusive sources of information due to past misinformation.
The bill lacks sufficient accountability and oversight for misuse of censorship powers.
It breaches privacy by compelling digital platforms to provide information about individuals.
The penalties for non-compliance are excessive and could suppress free speech.
Notable Quotes: This Bill is significant overreach by Government and the right to Freedom of speech under international laws of human rights and Covenant on Civil and political rights.
The Bill puts too much power in the hands of unelected bureaucrats to silence speech without transparency or accountability.
The severity of penalties for failing to comply with the misinformation codes is excessive and will have a spine-chilling effect on free speech.
